title: Fix a bug that causes nvcc to emit a redefinition of argument error
body_html:
From CMake 3.5 onwards, the host flag -std=c++11 is automatically
propagated to nvcc. Manually setting it causes nvcc to emit the
following error message:

nvcc fatal   : redefinition of argument 'std'

This fix prevents the flag from being set for versions of CMake >= 3.5,
thereby fixing the problem.
body_text:
From CMake 3.5 onwards, the host flag -std=c++11 is automatically
propagated to nvcc. Manually setting it causes nvcc to emit the
following error message:
nvcc fatal   : redefinition of argument 'std'

This fix prevents the flag from being set for versions of CMake >= 3.5,
thereby fixing the problem.
body:
From CMake 3.5 onwards, the host flag `-std=c++11` is automatically
propagated to nvcc. Manually setting it causes nvcc to emit the
following error message:

    nvcc fatal   : redefinition of argument 'std'

This fix prevents the flag from being set for versions of CMake >= 3.5,
thereby fixing the problem.
